edu.uci.calismall
Class Scrap

java.lang.Object
  edu.uci.calismall.CaliSmallElement
      edu.uci.calismall.Scrap
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<CaliSmallElement>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Scrap.Temp
public class Scrap
extends CaliSmallElement

A Calico scrap.

Scraps are collections of Stroke's that can be moved, scaled, copied, rotated together.

Scraps keep a list of all Stroke's that make part of them, and they also store a list of all scraps inside of them. To speed up the drawing process, strokes and children scraps are always kept inside the lists stored in the parent CaliSmall object.

Author:
Michele Bonazza

Field Detail

snapshotMatrix

protected final Matrix snapshotMatrix
The transformation matrix in use when modifying a scrap through bubble menu that is applied to the bitmap snapshot representing this scrap.

matrix

protected final Matrix matrix
The transformation matrix in use when modifying a scrap through bubble menu that is applied to the content of the scrap.

rollbackMatrix

protected final Matrix rollbackMatrix
The transformation matrix that keeps track of how to roll back from the last transformation matrix that has been applied to the scrap's border. This is kept to handle delta-like actions, since Path.transform(Matrix) only works with incremental updates.

scraps

protected final List<Scrap> scraps
All scraps children (but not grand-children) of this scrap.

strokes

protected final List<edu.uci.calismall.Stroke> strokes
All strokes belonging to this scrap.

The enclosing border of this scrap.

protected boolean selected
Whether this scrap is currently selected.

snapshot

protected Bitmap snapshot
The bitmap to which strokes are temporarily painted when editing the scrap.

regionColor

protected int regionColor
The color with which to fill the area of this scrap.

contentMatrix

protected Matrix contentMatrix
The transformation matrix in use when modifying a scrap through bubble menu that is applied to the content of the topmost scrap.

getStrokes

public List<edu.uci.calismall.Stroke> getStrokes()
Returns a list of all strokes whose parent is this scrap.

The list is not defensively copied, so editing the return object will alter this scrap's internal status.

Returns:
this scrap's children strokes

Returns:
this scrap's children scraps

public void erase()

draw

public void draw(CaliSmall.CaliView parent,
                 Canvas canvas,
                 float scaleFactor)
Draws this scrap to the argument canvas.

Drawing a scrap means drawing:

  1. the border delimiting the scrap
  2. the shaded region that highlights the content of the scrap
  3. all Scrap's within this scrap
.

Strokes are always taken by the list in the parent CaliSmall object, except for the outer borders, which are always kept inside scraps.

Parameters:
parent - the main View of the application
canvas - the canvas onto which this scrap must be drawn
scaleFactor - the current scale factor applied to the canvas

drawOnBitmap

public void drawOnBitmap(Canvas canvas,
                         Bitmap bitmap,
                         float scaleFactor)
Draws this scrap onto the argument bitmap. Used to take snapshots of a scrap when editing it.

Parameters:
canvas - the canvas onto which this scrap has to be drawn
bitmap - the bitmap onto which this scrap has to be drawn
scaleFactor - the scale factor that is currently applied to the canvas

getPointsForInclusionTests

public List<PointF> getPointsForInclusionTests()
Description copied from class: CaliSmallElement
Returns a list of all points that must be tested when performing inclusion tests.

This method is not required to make defensive copies, so altering the returned may alter the internal state of the object.

Specified by:
getPointsForInclusionTests in class CaliSmallElement
Returns:
a list containing all points of this element that must be included within some area for this element to be contained within said area
